comment: Excellent professor! I feel like I learned a lot about painting realistically from him. Make sure you listen to his feedback and apply what you learn and you will do well. If you take the class seriously and show that you want to learn about painting you will do well. Allows people to talk during class as long as you're working.

You will get better at painting with him. He genuinely cares about your work and wants to see you improve. I can honestly say painting is one of my strengths now because of him. Attendance matters and he can be a harsh grader but it's to make you better.

A great professor overall, I highly recommend taking him for his advice, he can really help you improve your art. He has high standards and focuses on realism which is reflected in the coursework. He is a caring teacher and built a positive classroom environment, I felt very inspired and my art really improved from taking his class.

Took him for figure and came back for painting because he is the best! Work hard and you will see so much improvement in your art. The due dates for the 4 major works (2 in class, 2 out of class) were well spread out so you have a lot of time to work and make your pieces good. Be sure to come to class because his advice is so valuable. Take him!

Prof. Remillard's class was the first studio art course where I could see my work improving throughout the semester. He gives helpful one-on-one critique during class and genuinely wants us to succeed. Plus he literally rewards good art with chocolate and didn't belittle me for crying in class (not his doing at all, I'm just an art major) TAKE HIM.

This class is tough, but Prof Remillard made it very fun! He's funny and chill, grades are tough and far few in-between, but he grades according to your efforts, so give it your all. He's very talented with oil painting, so he knows what he's talking about when he's giving you feedback. Overall, very cool guy, def recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: The best professor I have had at Kennesaw so far. He is super knowledgeable and wants you to do well in class. He is super caring and funny. He is a bit tough with grading but if he knows you are working hard he grades fairly. Take him!

This is not an easy class, but Prof Remillard is a great teacher! He gives great advice and feedback to improve your paintings. My cat died at the beginning of the semester and he was very kind and accommodating and encouraged me to do my midterm painting in his honor. Would definitely take him again. He also gives out candy during critiques!

Prof Remillard is great! He has been very beneficial in helping me learn the art of oil painting and he is always willing to help you when you need it. One main midterm in class and out of class painting and again for the final are your biggest grades. Attendance is mandatory but you can miss 3 days without it affecting your grade in the class.

amazing professor. i have taken prof. remillard for both figure and painting 1. after taking figure i knew that i had to take him again. he gives great feedback, and the environment he creates in his classes are so amazing. his work is hard, dont get me wrong, but i feel it's completely worth the struggle for the improvement youll see!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: Absolutely amazing teacher, I wish he would teach figure drawing more often. He will always have a live model for every class, so you are getting the best education for learning figures. There are a few at-home projects and 2 anatomy quizzes. Everyone improved in that class, so you know its good when you see everyone improve. MUST TAKE!

THE. BEST. PROFESSOR!!! I really didn't like painting until this class. Many of my classmates never painted in their life prior to the class and they all ended the semester with AMAZING artworks. He gives valuable critiques and helps you throughout the painting process. The workload is heavy and time-consuming bc he values realism.

Great professor who knows a lot about painting! Its a difficult class since most of us hadn't oil painted and its realism based so you measure a lot. You spend a LOT of time on each painting but the end result is worth it, you make some pretty great stuff if you come to classes, which is necessary. He grades a little tough but its still reasonable.

If you're ready to learn and advance your painting skills, take this Professor! He's one of KSU's most valuable assets so you cannot miss out on taking his classes. He is honest while staying kind and will help you if you ask. This class is as simple as doing the work, coming to class, and taking feedback to heart. He wants you to get better.

Uses finesse and knowledge when critiquing. I highly respect how he conducts his class. Hes funny, witty, and understanding. Hes beyond helpful. I felt like I actually learned in his class. He teaches on direct principles and elements rather than how he feels it should be done and lets your creativity grow too. What an art professor should be

I learned more from Remillard than literally any of my other gen art class professors. Take him if you value good feedback! Hes super nice and funny. If you put in the work and finish all of your assignments youll pass easily.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: He definitely pushes you to render everything as realistically as possible, and while I would consider myself to be more skilled than most of my classmates, he still pushes me to improve, rather than neglecting me like some teachers would, and I really appreciate that. I'm ready to learn a lot from him, but it's gonna be a lot of work.

Joe is fantastic, but be prepared to render everything realistically. He wants you to learn the way to do it realistically because once you learn the rules it's much easier to break them correctly. You'll end up doing a lot of work, but also learn a ton in the process.

Figure Drawing - 6 Drawings due outside of class, 4 quizzes on bones and muscles, almost all days outside of critique there's a model in the classroom.  Joe is incredibly helpful and kind, but you will need to put a lot of work in.

also took 3260 with remillard at the same time. i took painting 1 with him and it was great! but this semester- something must have happened... he has turned into a monster! i will not be taking him again any time soon and will be avoiding him like the plague. he had no compassion or empathy at all this semester! wtf?!

BEST Drawing/Painting teacher at Kennesaw. He is not easy, but he will help you as best as he can. He the only D/P teacher that actually supports and encourages concept artists and illustrators, his son even works at Massive Black. Warning: he is heavy on realism so if you have TREMENDOUS trouble rendering images accurately you might make a B.

I took Joe on a study abroad drawing class.  I think I cried every day in his class.  On the plus side, he made me a much better drawer.  He really is an excellent teacher if you admit that you need help.  If you just turn in the same stuff over and over... you're screwed.

if you're a realistic drawing prodigy then this is the class for you! if you aren't then get ready to work your butt off for a B if you're lucky. super hard grader, but still one of my favorite teachers.

Joe is a lot of fun, always helpful, and really cares about his students and art. His assignments allow for creative freedom though his classes are pretty structured. He expects quality and thought put into your projects; there are usually about 4-6 ones you'll do. I get more done with Joe than any other teacher.

He is one of the best professors I have ever had. I made an A in the class. You do have to make an effort to get an A. His classes keep you interested. Once a week you have the chance to submit your doodles that are done in class inorder to win a gift certificate. He is the kind of professor that I would want to hang out with out side of class.
One of the best professors I have ever had.The class was really easy, and I did not even have to study for the test, just had to remember like 80 pieces of art.
Helpful and knowledgable, but doesn't really teach actual color theory. I enjoyed his class.

He's a really nice teacher, but his class is not easy.  You learn a lot and its a funny class, but you have to spend like $30 going to these events, and you have to STUDY A LOT!!! He has only three test and they are hard like 15-20 ident. diff. works and the artist...a lot of info to rememebr! you have to study, u can't just show up for class!!
